cli.rag_unavailable: Documentation search unavailable. Continuing without RAG.
cli.welcome:
# Ask Ubuntu

Ask me anything about using Ubuntu! I can help you with:
- System administration tasks
- Package management (apt, snap)
- Configuration and customization
- Troubleshooting issues
- Command line tips and tricks

**Model:** `{model}`
**Documentation Search (RAG):** {rag_status}

**Special commands:**
- `/help` - Show this help message
- `/clear` - Clear the screen
- `/exit` or `/quit` - Exit the assistant
- `Ctrl+C` - Cancel current input
- `Ctrl+D` - Exit

**Tips:**
- Press `Esc` then `Enter` for multi-line input
- Use `↑` and `↓` to navigate command history
- Answers are grounded in actual Ubuntu man pages and documentation
cli.arg_description: Ask Ubuntu - AI-powered assistant for Ubuntu
cli.arg_model: Model to use (default: auto-detected from hardware tier)
cli.arg_embed_model: Embedding model to use for RAG (default: auto-detected from hardware tier)
cli.arg_debug: Show tool calls and other debug output
cli.info_panel.title: System Info & Help
cli.info_panel.tips: Press Esc then Enter for multi-line input. Use arrow keys to navigate history. Answers are grounded in actual Ubuntu man pages and documentation.
app.title: Ask Ubuntu
sidebar.system_subtitle: What the assistant knows about your system
welcome.heading: Ask Ubuntu
welcome.description: Your local AI assistant for Ubuntu
welcome.zoom_hint: Use Ctrl+Plus/Minus to zoom in/out, Ctrl+0 to reset. Press F1 for help.
suggestion.docker: How do I set up Docker?
help.title: Ask Ubuntu — Help
help.sidebar_description: The sidebar shows your system information that the assistant uses to give accurate, contextual answers about your Ubuntu system.
help.how_it_works_description: Ask Ubuntu uses a local AI model with access to Ubuntu documentation and your system context to provide helpful, grounded answers.
help.suggestions_description: Try asking about package management, system configuration, troubleshooting, or any Ubuntu-related topic. The assistant can run tools to inspect your system.
